002package apprepo;
003
004import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
005import static org.mockito.Mockito.never;
006import static org.mockito.Mockito.verify;
007import static org.mockito.Mockito.when;
008
009import java.io.IOException;
010import java.io.PrintWriter;
011import java.util.ArrayList;
012import java.util.List;
013
014import org.junit.After;
015import org.junit.Before;
016import org.junit.Test;
017import org.mockito.Mockito;
018
019import jakarta.servlet.RequestDispatcher;
020import jakarta.servlet.ServletContext;
021import jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
022import jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
023import jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession;
024
025public class SortServletTest {
026    private SortServlet sortServlet;
027    private HttpServletRequest request;
028    private HttpServletResponse response;
029    private PrintWriter writer;
030
031    @Before
032    public void setUp() throws IOException {
033        sortServlet = new SortServlet();
034        request = Mockito.mock(HttpServletRequest.class);
035        response = Mockito.mock(HttpServletResponse.class);
036        writer = Mockito.mock(PrintWriter.class);
037        HttpSession session = Mockito.mock(HttpSession.class);
038     // Set up mock behavior for getSession() to return the mock HttpSession
039        when(request.getSession()).thenReturn(session);
040        List<Application> appList = new ArrayList<>();
041        Application app = new Application();
042                app.setName("Test");
043                String linksStr = "TestLink" ;
044                String[] linksArray = linksStr.substring(1, linksStr.length() - 1).split(", ");
045        app.setLinks(linksArray);
046        appList.add(app);
047        // Set up mock behavior for getSession().getAttribute(String) if needed
048        when(session.getAttribute("applications")).thenReturn(appList);
049        
050     // Mock RequestDispatcher
051        RequestDispatcher dispatcher = Mockito.mock(RequestDispatcher.class);
052
053     // Mock ServletContext
054        ServletContext servletContext = Mockito.mock(ServletContext.class);
055        when(request.getServletContext()).thenReturn(servletContext);
056
057        // Set up mock behavior for getRequestDispatcher(String) to return the mock RequestDispatcher
058        when(request.getRequestDispatcher("/displayApplications.jsp")).thenReturn(dispatcher);
059
060        
061        // Mocking behavior for response.getWriter()
062        when(response.getWriter()).thenReturn(writer);
063    }
064
065    @After
066    public void tearDown() {
067        sortServlet = null;
068        request = null;
069        response = null;
070        writer = null;
071    }
072

089    @Test
090    public void testDoPost() throws Exception {
091        // Setting up mock request parameters (if needed)
092        when(request.getParameter("param1")).thenReturn("value1");
093
094        // Call doPost method
095        sortServlet.doPost(request, response);
096
097        // Verify that response was written correctly
098     //   verify(response).setContentType("text/plain");
099   //     verify(request.getSession().getAttribute("applications"), never()).saveUser(null);
100        List<Application> list = (List<Application>) request.getSession().getAttribute("applications");
101        assertTrue(list.size()!=0);
102
103        // Optionally, you can verify more interactions based on your servlet's behavior
104    }
105
106
107
108        @Test
109        public void testSortByAppName() {
110                //fail("Not yet implemented");
111                //SortServlet sortServlet = new SortServlet();
112                List<Application> applications = new ArrayList<Application>();
113                Application app1 = new Application();
114                app1.setName("B");
115                applications.add(app1);
116                Application app2 = new Application();
117                app2.setName("A");
118                applications.add(app2);
119                printAppList(applications);
120                sortServlet.sortByAppName(applications);
121                printAppList(applications);
122                assertTrue(applications.get(0).getName().equals("A"));
123                assertTrue(applications.get(1).getName().equals("B"));
124        }
125        
126        public void printAppList(List<Application> appList) {
127                
128                for (Application app:appList){
129                        System.out.print(app.getName()+ " ");
130                }
131                System.out.println();
132        }
133
134        
135}
